Disappointed in the renewal process

If I were rating only my experience with the customer service rep (Carlo) my rating for him would be a 4+. However, my experience with the totality of finding out that my contract had expired on July 10th was absolutely overwhelming and unsatisfactory. Apparently, a communication was sent via email in May 2022 meant to notify us that we were nearing the end of our contract. The primary heading of that email said that we did not have to do anything which we falsely assumed that
No action was required as stated at the top of the email was very misleading. Additionally, there are too many levels involved when there is a problem that needs to be rectified. I am appreciative that Carlo was knowledgeable of the process and helped resolve our issue. I still feel that we got dropped from the system once our rep left the company.

Very Pleasant Experience

I received an email offer nearly at the end of my car's original bumper-to-bumper platinum plan coverage through my bank's connections for a discount toward continuation of auto coverage with a third party. After I read the comparisons between Gold and Silver plans, I called the number a day later and got a live person immediately for the one question that I had about it to find out that it is a month-to-month pay as you go contract which works for me because I may decide to trade in or sell my car shortly after the 100k mark. Previously, I had to pay all at once for a 3-5 yr plan. This plan only charges me per month for coverage and I can stop it anytime without fees or hidden charges for up to 36 months! After a few days later I went online and filled out all the information and set up my contract hassle-free. Now I can maintain coverage once my Platinum plan expires and my Silver plan goes into effect next month.

I want to begin by saying maybe avoid…

I want to begin by saying maybe avoid buying from Carvana unless you need to. Selling to them is fine. If you do end up buying from them, ignore the "warranty" from forever car because, no matter how many times they say it covers something, all they tell you is what they DON'T cover, which is everything really. Maybe they only cover the engine dying? Who really knows bc first they offer you a deal saying it's an extension but after you sign up, you get the contract and it basically says what it don't cover only so good luck deciphering that. Then, there are extra steps you need to remember to cancel, you can trust call and cancel (even tho that's the only way to cancel), you have to call them, be in hold for a while, then tell them you need to cancel, they ask you questions then you have to wait for an email and you have to put everything you already told them on the phone to verify you really want to cancel. They told me they didn't cancel by phone only because people would cancel then be confused they canceled? Okay, but wht about all the people complaining you are taking their money?? I would think that would be worse because it is people's MONEY? So, anyway, their customer service is also terrible, the manager I had to talk to was Orlando and he just sounds like a broken record talking about the contract over and over, not helpful. I ended up just saying bye and hanging up after the 5th time he said the same thing. That was my experience, you can decide for yourself though. Definitely check out reviews on BBB, they are not as good as these reviews.

Poor Customer Service !!!

As soon as I purchased my policy I looked to see that the address was incorrect, fictitious in fact as it included an old street address and an unknown city in a state I have never lived in. Concerned about how it happened I called and was told the only way it got I there was because I entered the data. Really? Customer service thinks I don’t know where I live? And he had the audacity to tell me repeatedly it was my fault.
The poor customer service as well as the corrupt data put me off on the company’s integrity. I didn’t want to find out that the service would be null and void if and when I need it because of a glitch in the system.
I canceled my policy during the same call. Let’s see if he can get that right.

Update: In spite of Orlando’s reply I still believe I am intelligent enough to know my own address and how to enter it correctly when prompted. I chatted with a couple people before doing a cursory review of the policy and then going back for the purchase. So, yes, I completed the enrollment by myself online. The online application asked for confirmation of my car year make & model, VIN, my zip code and what level of deductible I wanted. Only at the point of payment was I asked for an address and although that was auto filled I confirmed it to be correct. The response to me asking how the address was so corrupt on the policy did not merit the repeated accusations that “I” entered bad data. By the time I called I had updated the data online myself. But I had lingering concerns about how it would affect the future performance of the policy. So I called to quell my doubts. I did not expect or deserve what I got. It did not need to end as it did.
I’m still waiting for an email confirmation that the policy was cancelled as discussed with Orlando.

What a Week!!!

I have had a terrible experience last week. I know you all are in a partnership with Carvana and Silver Rock. 1st my check engine light came on January 1st so it wasn’t anything that I could do at that time. I dropped my car off Monday to a in-network repair shop Autotrust Repairs LLC. When I dropped it off the check engine light was off but they I left it because they told me they will figure it out. The did a diagnostic test on it Tuesday afternoon the results should that “Excessive pistol ring blow by causing the engine to run rich” I was very confused as to what was just said to me. They told me that too much fun is running to the engine. They also to me that I would probably have to have my engine replaced. I really felt confused then, I only had my car for 1 month, I just made my 1st car payment. I was not happy at this point, the mechanic asked me if I was past the time to get my money back. This was definitely a red flag, now I’m very upset with Carvana for selling me a car with a major issue like this. So now Silver Rock is brought into this nightmare and they told Autotrust Repairs LLC that I need to bring my car to the dealership because it was still under the manufacturer warranty. But I had to pay $110 for the diagnostic test due to Silver Rock wanting me to bring my car to the dealership. So now Cowboy Kia brought into this nightmare. Wednesday Cowboy Kia called me and told me that my car was not covered by the manufacturer warranty due to me not being the original owner. Now I’m even more upset. It could have stayed at Autotrust Repairs LLC and I would not have to pay the $110 diagnostic fee because the cost would have carried over to the repairs that needed to be done. Cowboy Kia told me that they did not see the issue but they will do a recall repair on it. They also told me that my brakes needed to be replaced. Now I’m furious because this is something that Carvana should have caught before they put my car up for sale. Now Cowboy Kia is expecting me to pay a $240 fee for the brake work that need to be done. It’s a lot of people that dropped the ball on me and I am not happy. I file complaints through Silver Rock and Carvana and no one has reached out to me to help resolve this nightmare of a week. I gave you all a 1 ⭐️ I wish I could have given a 0 ⭐️. Because you all are in the same circle. Oh yeah I forgot I had to get a rental car for $150.

Membership in Action

I received information from Clark County credit Union in Nevada regarding ForeverCar coverage for car repair maintenance. CCCU was offering a discounted rate as a member to have coverage for my vehicle. I made phone contact with Emily from ForeverCar to gain more information on coverages. Emily was very personable, knowledgeable and Informative. She reviewed all coverage information including rental car reimbursement, trip interruption and roadside service. Emily discussed three different options for deductible, monthly payment information and disclaimers for coverage to be in effect. Based on information given during our conversation, I decided to enroll for the Silver Plan Coverage.
Thank you Emily for all your assistance in this matter and for your outstanding customer service.
I will recommend this beneficial coverage to any of my family or friends that are Clark County Nevada credit union members.

Most 3rd party warranties are a scam…Not This

Most 3rd party warranties are a scam at worst and terrible to work with at best. This one is different. I’ve never had any trouble processing claims and the shop does all the work of filing the claim. I literally just hand them the paper with the phone number to call when I drop off my car and that is it. No other steps. I even had to take my car to the dealership to get the backup camera fixed because the independent shop I use was not comfortable doing it. It was just a $50 fee for using an put of network shop but again, it was easy and hassle free. Worth every penny I pay each month and the small fee if it’s out of network. For me, it’s hard to put a value on having the peace of mind this provides. I sleep a little better knowing if my engine gives up or have some other major repair bill, it’s going to get taken care of with little effort on my part.

This is a terrible company with very…

This is a terrible company with very deceiving business practices. My credit union referred me to the company, so I made the mistake of thinking they were background checked and s safe bet. Here is my issue, when I was called the sales person advised me the silver package for coverage was a good package to invest in, but the platinum package was the best one they offered. January 2021, I purchased two packages at once, one for my mother (platinum) and one for me (silver). Between the months of April & May, I filed two claim after mycheck engine light come on. I took the car to my mechanic and after troubleshooting the issues he determined the camshaft sensor was band the headlights ECU needed to be replaced. We called ForeverCar and the mechanic was told to reach out to a third-party company. The third-party informed my mechanic there was no coverage passed on the vehicle's mileage. I called to dispute this with Forevercar and the end result was them explaining the Silver policy wording has to specifically state it covers a specific component that failed or it's not covered by the policy i.e my camshaft sensor failed, but the policy only states it covers a failure to the entire camshaft system. Also, the headlights computer was not listed per Orlando in customer service. The policy has been canceled as of May 2021. The Italians having a Proverb, 'He that deceives me once, its his fault; but if twice, its my fault.

Extended car warranty by Forevercar:

The extended car repair warranty sales representative, Miguel Pineda, was clear and articulate and knew his products very well. He answered my questions straight away. Mr. Pineda is a great asset for the “Forevercar”. Easily he gets a 5 Star survey rating. The 3Star rating is due to the excessive period of non-coverage (1000 miles) before my extended car warranty is activated. The product I chose was the Platinum policy. There are a few unassailable conditions that handicaps the integrity of this sale; 1.) the monthly cost expended and invested into this warranty with no safety net for spontaneous repairs before the 1000 (test) prequalification mileage is reached.
2.) During COVID-19 we are regulated and restricted in all directions which has lowered our annual driving (average miles) and our spontaneous travel daily. In short, conceivably it may prolong the time it takes to reach the targeted 1000 mile prequalification.
3.) This is seen as unreliable acess to a product that is paid for monthly. That is a pretty high investment for no coverage. All other insurance covers immediately where the payment is secured and a binder for policy coverage is acknowledged.
The rating of three is given to the company for this very questionable and unfavorable contractual condition.

I signed up today

I signed up today. upon receiving the contract FV216908, I noticed the "30 days AND 1000 miles" clause. I missed the AND 1000 miles. As it would take me 3 or even 4 months to drive 1000 miles I called your agent and immediately canceled, as I would get charged for 4 months before I could use the insurance. If this was 30 days OR 1000 miles whichever came first, this would be ok. Now if you decide to change this policy to not charge me until I reach 1000 miles I thought the insurance was a good deal and would like the insurance and you would get 5 stars.

Carlo was absolutely AMAZING

Carlo was absolutely AMAZING! He was exceedingly knowledgeable concerning the extended warranty package I was seeking. He was able to explain and answer all of my questions and concerns about the policy. He also followed up in a manner that wasn't overbearing. Furthermore, I appreciated that he didn't push or threaten that the quote given would only be available the day I called, which is what many of the other companies did in fact do. Without added pressure, I was able to thoroughly and comfortably review the sample contract, have my questions answered, and sign up when most convenient to me. Moreover, he directed me to join SunCoast Credit Union, which I had never known existed for county residents, in an effort to obtain the best possible price for the extended warranty policy I was interested in. Carlo's personality, professionalism, and knowledge made the process of signing up with Forever Car go so much more smoothly, and definitely contributed to my decision to choose Forever Car for my extended warranty. I genuinely look forward to dealing with Carlo if/when I need servicing through Forever Car. Thank you.

Dream mustang needs a repair

I purchased my dream car in Jan. 2020. It's a 2015, Competition Orange Ford Mustang with 28k miles. While driving I noticed that the drivers window always sounded like it was open a crack even though it was not. I also found at the same time that the rear backup camera was not working all the time. The plan coverage helped with the repairs of a window regulator which brings a power window up and down. The plan also replaced the camera in my car. My cost for the entire job was a deductible of $100. The plan saved me over $1,200. I have continued reassurance if anything else comes up that I can get it repaired for my $100 deductible. A great plan for anyone who owns a car.

I love all of the options and some advice

I love all of the options available and the comparable system being color coded. Make sure you read through each plan and also the warranty coverage agreement. Before choosing. I always do. It helps to know what to expect in the future. I have been in the auto industry for almost 30 years, so knowing what will or might happen with my particular vehicle 2018 Suburban, and current market repair prices; made my decision easy on which plan to choose. Being that said, my advice is to call your repair facility and ask what the repair will cost On your particular vehicle before you choose a plan and one last piece of advice; choose a lower deductible; it will save you when or if you need to use the warranty in the long run- well worth the extra $5 a month. Do your research, the monthly cost is well worth it.

Positive ending but not smooth sailing to get there

I went to my repair shop with a complaint of rough idle and vibration, only when applying brake at a full stop.
While it was there, I asked to check brakes, belts and hoses since I travel to Tampa a lot , in fact this week. I knew maintenance items were not covered, just wanted a safe vehicle.
I informed my repair facility that I have extended warranty coverage, and asked if they accept this, if it turned out we needed it. They said yes, no problem.
Melissa, from my repair shop called me with the findings:
It needed 3 motor mounts, the rear shocks were leaking, and they recommended an injection cleaning to remove carbon build up.
She said she would be happy to call and see what would be covered, if anything, before proceeding. I gave her my full contract # and the 800# to call, and said they could call me if needed to verify. About a half hour later, she called me back with bad news. She said (MRC) refused to work with their repair facility and when she asked to speak to a supervisor, was told that person was too busy to accept her call. Melissa referred to something about being a fleet provider and they can’t assist them with this request? We both had no idea what they were talking about.
Well, you could imagine my surprise. So I called (MRC) directly and conferenced Melissa into the call to find out what was going on.
My repair facility just bought the garage from previous owner in January of this year, and is keeping the name of Mitch’s Firestone, which is their DBA. Their corporate name is Elite Automotive Center and that’s how they file. The first person Melissa spoke to didn’t even ask questions to determine if she could assist her or not, she just heard the name Firestone and proceeded to read her the riot act and tell her there was nothing they could do. She didn’t even log that call, as I found out when we were on this conference call with Danielle. Danielle asked several questions while reviewing with a supervisor, and they were finally able to determine we could proceed with a claim. Hallelujah! (MRC) found their corporate name and they were included as a covered repair facility. This conference call took almost 2 hours to determine eligibility, to finalizing discussions of what would be covered, and next steps for my repair facility. It was not exactly a user friendly process, albeit ending positively because the motor mounts parts and labor were covered.
As a loan facilitator, I strongly encourage our staff to offer these services to members, as I am a strong believer of their value. That’s why I have them myself. We all have bad days, and previously working at a call center, I can empathize with the stresses of non-stop calls. I am hoping though, that the first women who took the call is the exception to the rule and not the rule. That could have went much smoother if she had taken the time to ask questions before refusing to help.
Overall, this 1 covered repair costs more than my entire policy did, so the products works and it lives up to its claims.

Predatory business practices

I purchased this warranty 18 months ago and never filed a claim until a few days ago. I recently had an issue with my car and attempted to file a claim since my transmission needs to be replaced. The adjuster refused to approve it and instead kept reiterating that I authorize (aka pay out of pocket) the repair shop to fully break down my transmission and look for another source of failure since I had a fluid leak and need to PROVE the transmission failed for another reason since fluid leaks aren’t covered. I've had other warranty providers and never had to prove the source of failure. Sidebar: I would've stayed with my previous warranty provider (which I had FOR SEVERAL YEARS) but they no longer offered coverage for my vehicle since its an older model.

I purchased a powertrain warranty that includes transmission coverage. When I called customer service I spoke to 3 different people who gave me the run around. The worst was Blake who asked me to show him where in my contract the specific part that was damaged in my transmission was listed. Carlotta the adjuster/assessor was no help and I was told she was the 'manager'. She was clearly fed up with me inquiring about my claim which was indicated in her tone of voice and continued sighing throughout our call. So at the end of the day this warranty is a waste of money. The transmission is covered but not the specific part that's broken in the transmission? Hmmm interesting...

This is truly pathetic/horrible customer service and you’re better off going with another warranty provider. I am cancelling my warranty and posting a review on every known site (Google, Yelp, IG, Facebook, BBB, etc). I’ve already wasted my time and money but hopefully I can save future customers from being preyed upon.

Sale and initial service of Forevercar agreement

While we can’t yet (and hopefully won’t ever have to) speak regarding the fairness and effectiveness of our Forevercar agreement as we just purchased it, we do feel we’ve been treated very well thus far. Brian Sirt was the person we dealt with and he could not have been more thorough and professional. He was very patient with us and our many questions, we never felt a sense of being pressured by him at all.

The location that Forevercar sent us for our initial inspection was a shop I was unfamiliar with but was equally impressed not only by the reviews on Yelp and other sites but by the way they handled the inspection process. While discussing with the shop manager used vehicle warranty companies he was upfront that he had not dealt with Forevercar directly but he was impressed that they required the level of inspection they had the shop perform prior to offering us a warranty/service contract. His words were to the effect “he though if a warranty company requires an initial inspection it makes it that much easier for all parties to feel comfortable with the warranty should a covered repair be needed down the road”

If down the road we need to utilize our agreement with Forevercar for a covered repair or repairs, we hope that the same level of care and professionalism will be extended to us at that time.

Buyer BEWARE

Buyer BEWARE! Check first with your preferred mechanic or dealer to see if they will honor this coverage. My dealer refused to work with them due to the time involved in trying to get claims processed. Additionally, I didn't find this out until I had already had the coverage for 6 months and spent $450. That money was refused to be refunded to me on the grounds that they didn't break the contract in their eyes. When asked for a list of providers local to me they gave me one. The one they provided wasn't an acceptable option for me. Bottom line is that if you don't verify first that your mechanic will honor this warranty you can expect to go through a hassle at a minimum, and lose money in the process. I will add that I checked with both local Jeep dealers, as well as an independent mechanic that a friend of mine uses and not only did they say they wouldn't work with this insurance but they gave the reason that it's too much a hassle to get claims processed through this carrier.

Car repair done easy

I have had a problem with Car repair company’s not trusting in businesses like Forever car. But Forever Car has made a believer out of at least one of them. Gordon Chevrolet gave me a hard time about getting paid from the warranty and how they would hold my vehicle until payment is received. That was the attitude until they talked to the Claims department for Forever Car and his disposition change and he said he had the easiest and best experience with them. Made it a breeze to get everything done. Thanks for the professionalism and great work Forever Car.

I can’t thank forever car enough for…

I can’t thank forever car enough for being there for me!! I paid my monthly for 11 months and was beginning to think “why am I doing this? I’m just wasting money,” but I kept it up and then... BOOM. My transmission went out. I immediately dreaded the process that I believed laid before me. My mind was BLOWN. They sent a wrecker within 2 hours to my house to get my vehicle and took it to my Nissan service department. Once the diagnosis was complete, they sent a Nissan certified rebuilt transmission to Nissan within 5 days (the Nissan folks were blown away as most extended warranty companies send dirty salvaged parts. This transmission was clean and ready for install). I paid my $100+$9 tax and I had a $1700 transmission installed. I couldn’t be happier with forever car. I just had to cancel because I bought a new(ish) car that is still under factory warranty, but when it’s not anymore, I’m 100% signing back up for forever car. Do not hesitate, do not wait, do not overthink this... sign up now and lay your anxiety to rest. ESPECIALLY if you drive rideshare. Do it!!

BMW and ForeverCar vs. Endurance

I ended up buying a policy through Assurant. It is a bit more expensive than the ones offered by Interstate, but I am hoping they will actually pay claims. I hate insurance, but my BMW is out of warranty and a few minimal issues could hit $3000+ pretty easily. I was also shopping Endurance, but I thought Assurant would be more likely to pay out even though they are more expensive than Endurance. Honestly, I am on the fence if I made the right choice between the two companies. I did a claim test this morning and Assurant had a call me back feature whereas Endurance had me on hold for about 30 minutes when I tried to replicate the claims process.

Bought Forever Car

Bought Forever Car, now they are saying that I should have never been able to buy it in the first place. Now my car sits at the dealership needing a new clutch, and they say it doesn't cover manual transmission or manual transmission clutches. Also, it isn't a manual it is an automatic transmission. The clutch is an internal lubricated part, it should be covered, it is inside cast aluminum and it needs to have oil to work properly. Forever car is also saying this isn't their issue it is Interstate's issue. They are just passing the buck onto Interstate who I have already called and they said to call Forever Car to straighten this out. Again, my car is sitting at a BMW dealership and now they are saying my contract is void because nobody wants to pay out and are coming up with EXCUSES. Why am I being blamed for this? I spoke with Orlando Wilson from Forever car and he didn't seem to understand my vehicle was an auto and not a manual. He also seemed to know little about cars and intern lubricated parts.

Make sure to read through the contract

Make sure to read through the contract. There are multiple stipulations that serve as easy outs for them to not cover any repairs. One of them that is particularly ambiguous is the "Modified car" one. I inquired as to what that means and they stated that basically any non-manufacturer modification disqualifies vehicle from coverage. Dealer installed aftermarket exhaust or wheels on your car? Good for you. You replaced a broken radio? Goodbye. Dared to install aftermarket headlights? Have a good day. The way they told me, ANYTHING non-stock will void their service contract, which automatically puts a huge chunk of people into a bad situation.

My sales peson was friendly and helpful

My sales person was friendly and helpful. She guided me to the right product for me, without pressure. That said, my comfort level with the process was not high. Given the bad name that the extended auto warranty industry has I wanted to proceed with extreme caution. Handing out your credit information to a company ypou've never heard of is disconcerting. My main issue was that I could not a quote in writing, by email. Such a quote would contain, at a minimum, the amount of the monthly premium, the term of the contract, the miles and years of the coverage and a detailed account of what was covered. The declarations page defining all this detail is not availble until afer you sign up. I don't fault the sales person for this, but I do fault the system.

I cannot comment at all on whether or not this company will deliver on its promises. It may be years before I file a claim. I will not know until then if I can recommend this company to others. If you are a prospective buyer, please proceed with caution.

Do Not sign up with this company

When I was talked into signing up with ForEver Car warranty I was told that if I changed my mind I would have no issues with getting my money refunded and my account cancelled as long as I did it within the first 30 days, after really doing research and looking over reviews I decided the very next day to cancel my account. I called back in an of course they tried to talk me out of cancelling finally after 5 days I was told my money would be refunded within 7 days and account cancelled. I've called in several times to verify that this has been done and no one that I speak to can tell me it's always they'll give my name and number to someone and have them call me back, if I'm having this much trouble trying to make sure my account is cancelled imagine what it would be like if I needed my car repaired. Please take my warning.
